entities.name: kendra
entities.description: Kendra is mentioned as someone who has died. The text states that Bathilda was the only person in Godric's Hollow who was on speaking terms with Dumbledore's mother, implying that Kendra had a relationship with her.

entities.name: bathilda
entities.description: Bathilda is mentioned as someone who was on speaking terms with Dumbledore's mother. The text also states that Bathilda exhibited brilliance earlier in her life, but it has now dimmed.

entities.name: godric's hollow
entities.description: Godric's Hollow is mentioned as a location where Bathilda was the only person on speaking terms with Dumbledore's mother.

entities.name: dumbledore's mother
entities.description: Dumbledore's mother is mentioned as someone who had a relationship with Kendra and Bathilda. The text states that Bathilda was the only person in Godric's Hollow who was on speaking terms with her.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is not explicitly mentioned in this passage, but his mother is mentioned as having a relationship with Kendra and Bathilda.

relationships.description: The text states that Bathilda was the only person in Godric's Hollow who was on speaking terms with Dumbledore's mother.
The text implies that Kendra had a relationship with Dumbledore's mother, as Bathilda was the only person in Godric's Hollow who was on speaking terms with her.
